tweets.text: Pleased Environment Agency is meeting with campaigners to discuss Welsh Harp next week. Not so pleased at state of River Brent trash trap today. Grills still bent & broken 50m from protected wetland. Is regular maintenance really that hard, @EnvAgencySE? https://t.co/1LMca3vLbL

We can now see it’s not the @EnvAgency being scared of an orphaned site , they’re scared of footing the bill to restore it . It’s a case of The EA with no money , red with no interest and us in the middle with no quality of life . @StinkStopthe

The stench is horrendous again tonight, reported as far as Trentham, Blurton, Kidsgrove - difficult to breathe outside in #NUL and invading flat again. Trying to block doors and windows. Where are you @EnvAgency? This is horrendous. @StinkStopthe #stopthestink #capitoff

Our fisheries officers out across #Sussex with @SussexRuralCops/@anglingtrust 

Almost 30 spots checked. Most anglers fishing legally 😀 but three reported for not ☹️ 

Catch yourself a fishing licence: https://t.co/XNE2FrMuYl
#GetFishing #GetaLicence
Pix: #RiverAdur/#RiverRother https://t.co/1YI0CsDU32

Summary of meeting with the @EnvAgencyMids on Monday 10th May 2021 to discuss permanent #StopTheStink monitoring solutions for Walleys Quarry Landfill. Too many characters to fit here, so please read here instead: https://t.co/OcXAbgpPoU

@tw33tie1 @EnvAgencyMids I suspect failure to manage the surface water has been a major contributor. As large amounts of water percolate through the heap, they will carry organic matter particles into the older parts of the heap where there is (legally) more gypsum, triggering the strong H2S production.

urls.title: ‘It’s terrifying’: the English village overwhelmed by landfill stink
urls.description: For miles around Walleys Quarry near Newcastle-under-Lyme, people have reported waking up in the night struggling to breathe

tweets.text: This is in Silverdale, #NewcastleUnderLyme #Staffordshire - landfill related. Come on, @EnvAgency - #StopTheStink.    https://t.co/pj1wIergwr

For those not aware the man behind Red Industries / Walleys Quarry has previous. How does ⁦@EnvAgency⁩ issue permits for potentially toxic facilities to companies without a ‘fit and proper’ person test on owners and directors? They used to do it. https://t.co/2QW0XxUdIy

tweets.text: Do your job @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgencyMids Close it down & cap it off. #StopTheStink https://t.co/ldLZeS9jcE

@SianieRoo @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off Yes, that is probably a combination of things (tho don't underestimate the power of doing the easy thing when there is no time). What is happening in Silverdale is not isolated either. There's raw sewage going into a river in Cornwall, not to mention the landfill issues elsewhere

The @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA definitely need more money, they’re saying they’ve no money to monitor the landfill longer term - we’ve not even solved the fumes yet so this is v v concerning! I don’t buy the due diligence tho, he was already known to them @Cap_it_off #stopthestink https://t.co/O0evVeHSDu

tweets.text: @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe I really hope they don't wait for the summer when due to warm weather the gases will dispers into higher atmosphere. I really believe that the only other option we have it's court/law/ huge compensation.

@SianieRoo @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency 25 mins in queue to report horrendous stink tonight, operator asked to do overtime due to number of calls, all 9pm when toxic gas was resale see upon us, someone must know what's going on. #stopthestink
